courseDescription:
This course is an excellent place to start if you want to be a Scrum master, are adopting Scrum in your workplace, or simply want to be a more agile team. It is built on the best learning objectives of the Scrum Alliance and Scrum.org to provide you with current, market-relevant content. Additionally, once you finish this course, you will be able to increase your knowledge with part two of this series: Mastering Advanced Scrum – A Scrum Master Training Course.

A Scrum master is a Scrum team member responsible for fostering an effective and productive working environment and guiding others in understanding Scrum values, principles, and practices. Scrum masters are people-oriented, have high emotional intelligence, and enjoy assisting team members in growing. The material in this course shows you how to effectively guide your team in using Scrum and will consider why Scrum values are so important. Learn how to improve communication between the product owner, Scrum Team members, customers, stakeholders, and executives.

This course is an excellent opportunity to improve your implementation skills, distinguish yourself in the global marketplace, and demonstrate advanced value to your employer or potential employer as a highly trained Agile professional. Since it is based on the most recent techniques and best practices, it would be a wise choice to enrol in this course now and start your journey to mastering Scrum today. Updated 15/12/22.

modules.description: In this module, you will gain knowledge about how Scrum is aligned with Lean thinking and the values and principles of the Manifesto for Agile Software Development. You will also learn about the historical development of Scrum and agile.
topics: Lean, Agile, and Scrum - Learning Outcomes
Lean, Agile, and Scrum - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will understand how Scrum works by gaining some familiarity with the Scrum framework and its business value to organizations. You will learn how the three roles, the five events, and the three artifacts (the 3-5-3 structure) are tied together.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will understand why a Scrum Master should be a 'master' or expert in Scrum and should develop the ability to coach the team in the values, principles, and processes of the Scrum framework.
topics: Scrum Master Core Competencies - Learning Outcomes
The Scrum Master and the Scrum Guide
Attributes of a Good Scrum Master
What Is a Scrum Master’s Day Like?
Scrum Master Core Competencies - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Understanding and Applying the Scrum Framework - Formative Assessment
modules.description: Test your knowledge of Scrum, its concepts, framework, and its application as you have learned in this chapter by answering a few questions. Also, test your knowledge of the role of a Scrum master in the implementation of scrum.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will understand how the Scrum Master serves the Scrum team, particularly by coaching them in self-management and cross-functionality.

Facilitating the Creation of a Team’s Definition of Done
Service to the Scrum Team - Learning Outcomes

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will understand how Scrum Masters serve Product Owners, particularly by coaching them in Scrum, product management, and how to collaborate with the team.
